fields.label_text: The relief is a preliminary sketch-model for the bronze relief set in the plinth of Giovanni Bologna's marble group of the Rape of the Sabines unveiled under the Loggia de'Lanzi in Florence in 1583. The model was abandoned presumably because the over-ambitious composition failed to work satisfactorily: the eventual bronze relief is composed quite differently and more simply. The sketch shows in the centre the games of the Consualia which served the Romans as the pretext for inviting the Sabines. In the bronze this feature was omitted.

fields.descriptive_line: Model Relief "The Rape of the Sabines" in terracotta by Giambologna, ca. 1582, Florence, Italy
fields.physical_description: A crowded composition of Romans and Sabines grouped around the monument of a hero with seated figures on the base; three of the Romans are mounted. The architectural background is roughly sketched in.
fields.title: The Rape of the Sabines
fields.label: The relief is a preliminary sketch-model for the bronze relief set in the plinth of Giovanni Bologna's marble group of the Rape of the Sabines unveiled under the Loggia de'Lanzi in Florence in 1583. The model was abandoned presumably because the over-ambitious composition failed to work satisfactorily: the eventual bronze relief is composed quite differently and more simply. The sketch shows in the centre the games of the Consualia which served the Romans as the pretext for inviting the Sabines. In the bronze this feature was omitted. [dec 1995]
fields.public_access_description:
The relief is a preliminary sketch-model for the bronze relief set in the plinth of Giovanni Bologna's marble group of the Rape of the Sabines unveiled under the Loggia de'Lanzi in Florence in 1583. 

The model was abandoned presumably because the over-ambitious composition failed to work satisfactorily: the eventual bronze relief is composed quite differently and more simply. The sketch shows in the centre the games of the Consualia which served the Romans as the pretext for inviting the Sabines. In the bronze this feature was omitted.

fields.history_note: The relief is a preliminary sketch-model for the bronze relief set in the plinth of Giovanni Bologna's marble group of the Rape of the Sabines unveiled under the Loggia de'Lanzi in Florence in 1583. The model was abandoned presumably because the over-ambitious composition failed to work satisfactorily: the eventual bronze relief is composed quite differently and more simply. The sketch shows in the centre the games of the Consualia which served the Romans as the pretext for inviting the Sabines. In the bronze this feature was omitted.
